newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Fletcher Paper stars as NZ share market ends flat.
newsitem.headline: Fletcher Paper stars as NZ share market ends flat.

text.p: * Fletcher Paper rises 13 cents on flat market
* Telecom sheds div but still very weak
* Brierley firm despite weakness in Thistle
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
328 +4 * NZSC cap index -34.8 at 5,098.78
360 -2 * Volume NZ$44.43 million. Futures -2 at 1136
651 -18 * Other movers - -14 -12
Fletcher Paper rose strongly against a flat New Zealand share market on Monday.
The top 40 index dropped 8.89 to 2,280.07 mainly thanks to a number of stocks shedding dividends but Fletcher Paper spurted 13 cents ahead to $3.09.
Volume was typically light for a Monday at $44.4 million with much of it in Telecom, which dipped 18 cents to $6.51 including shedding a 9.5 cent dividend.

J.B. Were broker Luke Koekoek said Tuesday could be an interesting session as Telecom was nearing perceived support levels. The company announced after the close that it had bought back a further 925,400 shares between $6.51 and $6.63 in its ongoing NZ$1 billion buyback programme.
Fletcher Paper was helped higher by news that Fletcher Canada had sold its stake in Timberwest for C$22 a share.
A Sydney Morning Herald article suggesting News Ltd could be ready to sell its stake in Australian Newsprint Mills to Fletcher also helped.
Fletcher, the other half owner of ANM, refused News' A$300 million price last year and the price this year is picked to be much lower.
There was also demand for Fletcher Paper warrants, brokers said.
Investors in Fletcher Building took heart from a strong result from cement company Milburn. It ended square on $4.15 as did Milburn on $3.05.
-- Simon Louisson 64 4 4714 276
